metadata.title: CVE-2015-3225 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
lib/rack/utils.rb in Rack before 1.5.4 and 1.6.x before 1.6.2, as used withRuby on Rails 3.x and 4.x and other products, allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (SystemStackError) via a request with a largeparameter depth.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librack-ruby - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3
librack-ruby1.8 - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3
librack-ruby1.9.1 - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3
ruby-rack - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ruby-rack package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-3+deb8u3').
ruby-rack1.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
